climbs.name: Slumdog
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon,  Rhesa Ashbacher, Tucker Tech, Dave Cox, Justin Slagle

content.description: Slumdog    5.7 *    This the left of 2 routes above and left of Gravity Rock      Over a small roof, up a crack, then past some bolts, ending with a few tied off horns/chickenhead.  2 bolt anchor on top.  Walk off back and to the right.
content.protection: A few trad pieces (small to med.), quick draws for some bolts, and some runners for knobs near the top.
content.location: Just up and left of Gravity Rock.

content.description: On the left side of the face to the left of the big chimney, climb a seam past a protrusion, then up right.
This is the right of two routes above (and left) of Gravity Rock. Up over a roof (FP), up some cracks, and then past a few bolts to the top.
content.protection: Some trad gear (small to med) and a few bolts. 2 bolt anchor on top.
content.location: Up and left of Gravity Rock

content.description: This is the center seam. Move left to a shallow corner at about two thirds height,then up.

climbs.name: Feel the Love
climbs.fa: Steve Gerberding, Scott Cosgrove & Al Swanson, 2003

content.description:
Intriguing climbing up a mostly vertical face on high quality rock makes this one of the better routes in the area and one to seek out if climbing at the grade.

Climb vertical face up good edges to gain a hueco and then make an athletic rockover move onto a small ledge. Higher an easy slabby section leads to the base of a grey headwall where more fun awaits. A few moves on scrappy rock quickly give way to much better rock and a committing stand-up maneuver past the 5th bolt, after which nice grey edges gain the anchors.
content.location: On a north-facing wall in a small cove.
